ygData.subject: Re: Mend, my most useless and irritating skill.
ygData.msgSnippet: Once you have reached 101 in mend you have mastered it and it should almost never fail again i am lvl 30 monk now and since lvl 20 when i mastered mend it has
ygData.messageBody:
Once you have reached 101 in mend you have mastered it and it should almost
never fail again
i am lvl 30 monk now and since lvl 20 when i mastered mend it has failed
about 3 times and has not worsended my wound
ever. just keep practicing it and it will get better don't worry.
----- Original Message -----
From: "James W Hooper" <jhooper@...>
To: <EQ_Monk@onelist.com>; <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, January 14, 2000 8:57 PM
Subject: [EQ-Monks] Mend, my most useless and irritating skill.


> From: James W Hooper <jhooper@...>
>
>
> Of the monks that I know, it seems that I have the worst luck at getting
my
> Mend skill to work, especially in high risk combat situations. I have
> maxed out the skill at 17th level. This is not an exaggeration.
Yesterday
> I was soloing scarecrows in West Karana. I was earning a little Xp and
> practicing my newly aquired FD skill, which did work, I used mend 4 times
> in about a 2 hour period of time. It worked once, failed twice, and
> worsened my wounds the last time, which killed me when I had a white
> scarecrow on its last legs. My character basically committed suicide at
> the point where he was going to win. As I said, it seems I have the worse
> luck with Mend. Does any one else have this problem or am I just the
> victim of bad numbers?
>
> Shando, 17th circle, Silent Fist Clan
> Bertoxxulous
>
>
